rounds.comments: (Alex: Because all of the responses are double-talk.)

clues.text: In certain jokes it comes before "Who's there?"
In a 1939 movie this dog is in danger of being put down after biting a neighbor
The White House Press Secretary during Clinton's first term had this double-talk first name
This high-kicking dance was a favorite of Parisian music hall girls
New York New York & this double talk hotel are at opposite ends of the Las Vegas Strip

rounds.comments: (Alex: It's all about the '80s, isn't it?  Yeah.)  (Al: You had to give 'em that clue.)

clues.text: At a 1986 summit in Iceland, Ronald Reagan & this Russian leader met to continue historic talks on reducing nukes
On May 22, 1980 Namco began gobbling up the competition by releasing this video game
A historic 1989 event in this Asian plaza is also called the June 4th Incident
A commander of Panama's National Guard, he promoted himself to general in 1983 & life was good for him... for a while
In 1982 artificial heart recipient Barney Clark survived 112 days with a device called this-7
No beans about it: for your first challenge, you'll be making (what else?) this dish that Texans call a "bowl of red"
Start slicing & dicing for some stir-fry made in this Chinese bowl-shaped pan
Be creative & use lima beans instead of chickpeas to make this Middle Eastern pita shmear
Prepare your paella, but don't waste any of this yellowish spice, the most expensive in the world
For dessert you'll be making Italian cheesecake with this, meaning "recooked" in Italian
After playing the Sundance Kid, this actor charmed in 1972's satirical "The Candidate"
Jimmy Stewart is a naive senator who launches a filibuster in this Capra classic
This Ryan Gosling political thriller shares its name with the last day of Julius Caesar's life
"You can't fight in here--this is the War Room", says President Merkin Muffley in this Kubrick film
Dustin Hoffman & Robert de Niro cook up a war in Albania in this "canine" comedy
This Cabinet dept. is responsible for conserving the country's land, water, minerals, fish & wildlife
A conservative this 8-letter word is a lowball judgment of an amount or value
Dress conservatively to see the Queen in a meeting called this, also a word for a theater crowd
Helmholtz gave us the law of conservation of this, also what you do when you take it easy at the start of a long run
"Conserv"ative name for a music school; New York's Juilliard is a famed one
Let's party with former New Mexico governor Gary Johnson, standard bearer for this party in 2012
A toilet in the Palm Springs home of this late flamboyant piano player was made to look like an actual throne
Around 1970 it was the common 2-word name for what today we just call feminism
This country's first & only monarch was King Idris, who was deposed in 1969
Term for the words to an opera; Venetian poet Lorenzo da Ponte wrote the one for Mozart's "Don Giovanni"
He died September 30, & Charlie McCarthy hasn't spoken since
On January 19, Volkswagen halted production of this model in Germany
Warren Beatty's 1978 film was a remake of 1941's "Here Comes Mr. Jordan", not this, its 1943 namesake
His hitting streak stopped at 44 games, disappointing everybody except maybe Joe DiMaggio
In January, 35 new trainees for this job were announced, including 6 women & 3 blacks
David Hockney's show at LACMA featured a portrait of this late "Hairspray" star--in male attire
Ptolemy I was the daddy, not the mummy, of the famed museum & library in this city
This Hollywood store's Bra Museum boasts bras worn by Madonna, the Pointer Sisters, & even Tony Curtis
This religious leader's former residence, Beehive House, is now a museum
The cabildo where this agreement was signed in 1803 now houses part of the Louisiana State Museum
There's an estimated average of 1/2 a ton of these nocturnal crawlers in an acre of soil
They have about twice the number of legs as centipedes of the same length
A slug is basically a land snail that doesn't have a prominent one of these
A spineless jellyfish does this by alternately relaxing & contracting its bell
Audubon says these ants "have no fixed place of abode...occupying only temporary bivouacs"
In this fairy tale, the last words spoken by one of the 3 animal characters were, "And here she is"
"Tunnel in the Sky" & "A Wrinkle in Time" are 2 novels for children written in this genre
Title adjective describing the wilderness "journey" of 2 dogs & a cat to find the humans they love
Winnie-the-Pooh's real name
Of the 4 Bremen Town Musicians, it's the only 2-legged animal
Zane, or Lady Jane
Poet Edgar, whether or not he was invited to dinner
A brown & white cow or its Channel Island home
It commonly precedes "drop" or "Arabic"
This word for "sociable" comes from the Latin meaning "belonging to a flock"
This Smith graduate went to India to study politics before founding Ms. Magazine
She married a man named Fortune, but after a few anthropological field trips, they got divorced
Sadly, she died 14 years before the 19th Amendment gave women the right to vote
"Ramona" author Helen Hunt Jackson & this poetess were childhood playmates in Amherst, Mass.
She was a nurse, cook & spy during the Civil War, but was best known as the Moses of her people

rounds.text: A 1964 essay coined this 2-word term for "artistically serious" comic books & endorsed it over "illustories" & "picto-fiction"
